replace.flavor: He is devious and cunning, in both appearance and deed. Beware the Warbeard, for this brute bites as well as he barks!
"O! call back yesterday, bid time return." —William Shakespeare, King Richard the Second
Harthag gave a jolly laugh as he surveyed the army before him. "Ho ho ho! Midgets! You think you can stand in my way?"
". . . [A]nd gives to airy nothing/ A local habitation and a name." —William Shakespeare, A Midsummer-Night's Dream
"O! it is excellent/ To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous/ To use it like a giant." —William Shakespeare, Measure for Measure
"‘Tis distance lends enchantment to the view,/ And robes the mountain in its azure hue." —Thomas Campbell, "Pleasures of Hope"
And then the Archangel Anthius spoke to them, saying, "Fear shall be vanquished by the Sword of Faith."
"Foolish wizard! As you tap the power of your lofty keep, so grows my strength." —Malvern Xelionos, Letters
"This is the forest primeval. The murmuring pines and the hemlocks . . . / Stand like Druids of old." —Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, "Evangeline"

"Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me!/ Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant
Nethya stiffened suddenly, head cocked as if straining to hear some distant sound, then fell lifeless to the ground.
"How dull it is to pause, to make an end,/ To rust unburnished, not to shine in use,/ As though to breathe were life!" —Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Ulysses"
"Leviathan, too! Can you catch him with a fish-hook/ or run a line round his tongue?" —Job 40:25
"Remember Sir Shandlar! Remember and stand firm!" —rallying cry of the Eberyn militia
"Ow! Ow ow ow! Oooh, ow, OW!"
So confusing is the Wall's appearance that few of its victims even see it move.
"Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!" —William Shakespeare, King Lear
